value.verse: Lord, you have been our refuge *

Before the mountains were brought forth,
or the land and the earth were born, *
value.halfverse: from age to age you are God.

value.verse: You turn us back to the dust and say, *
For a thousand years in your sight are like yesterday when it is past *
value.halfverse: and like a watch in the night.

value.verse: You sweep us away like a dream; *
value.halfverse: we fade away suddenly like the grass.

value.verse: In the morning it is green and flourishes; *
value.halfverse: in the evening it is dried up and withered.
we are afraid because of your wrathful indignation.
value.verse: For we consume away in your displeasure; *

value.halfverse: and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.
value.verse: Our iniquities you have set before you, *
When you are angry, all our days are gone; *
value.halfverse: we bring our years to an end like a sigh.

yet the sum of them is but labor and sorrow,
 for they pass away quickly and we are gone.
value.verse:
The span of our life is seventy years,
perhaps in strength even eighty; *
Who regards the power of your wrath? *
So teach us to number our days *
value.halfverse: that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.

value.verse: Return, O LORD; how long will you tarry? *

value.halfverse: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.
value.verse: Satisfy us by your loving-kindness in the morning; *
Make us glad by the measure of the days that you afflicted us *
value.halfverse: and the years in which we suffered adversity.
and your splendor to their children.

prosper the work of our hands;
 prosper our handiwork.
value.verse: May the graciousness of the LORD our God be upon us; *
